description.narrative: India will soon become the world’s most populous country and is expected to have one of the highest economic growth rates in the coming decades. Combined with the expectation that India will account for 30% of the increase in global electricity demand towards 2040, it will be one of the largest global markets for renewable energy (RE) in both the short and long-term. India has set ambitious targets on renewable energy with 175 GW in 2022 and 450 GW in 2030. To be able to shorten the implementation time for the transition to renewable energy, the India-Denmark Energy Partnership (INDEP) will draw on Denmark’s world-leading experiences from its low-carbon transition through a government-to-government peer-to-peer partnership to assist Indian authorities in establishing the framework conditions needed for the green transition in the energy sector. Impact at outcome level will be evaluated in a mid-term review in 2023 and in the final report in 2025. Project implementation progress is measured by a yearly report on accomplishment of activities in the annual workplan (measured by a percentage of total planned activities)
Overall inteded impact: Reduced greenhouse gas emissions and leverage of the partnership in mobilising further resources for India¿s green transition.
